title: Senior Instructional Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fairfield University
Interview Descriptions:
An HR coordinator reached out to me to schedule an interview over a week after I applied.
The first interview was 30 minutes with a Director and Assistant VP. They were both very nice and the interview was casual but with prepared routine questions. 

I was told I should hear back in the next week either way.
Two weeks later I had not heard anything from HR so I reached out to the same coordinator to ask for an update (not expecting any good news at this point). 
I got a reply from a different HR person that I'm not moving forward, 2 days after reaching out.
I got the feeling they had no intention of ever letting me know.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
How do you stay up to date with technologies
Have you ever had a contentious relationship with a coworker and how did you handle it?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Fairfield University
Interview Descriptions: super easy zoom interview. Behavioral questions. Panel of people interview you and some are students and others are pro staff. Long application process though and had many screening questions. Easy though, they were about yourself and how you would improve the building.
Interview Questions: Please Tell me about yourself

title: Annual Giving Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fairfield University
Interview Descriptions: They wanted my past employer’s strategies and that is all they were interested in and if I was willing to implement them in their office.   I met with two department heads together.
Interview Questions: They only wanted information about my past employer

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fairfield University in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: quick maybe 10-15 min, asks about skills, major and previous work history. Very to the point, seemed rude but I think it was just to actually get the interview over with.
Interview Questions: can you tell me about yourself

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Fairfield University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, and got a phone interview in a few days. Interviewer asked me specific questions that related to my resume/cover letter so it had a nice personal touch. Immediately after the interview, they asked my availability to fly me out for an in-person interview. Interview was easy, and was offered the job two days from the interview. Hiring was fine, but HR can be a little slow.
Interview Questions: How do you live out the Jesuit values in your personal/professional life?

title: IT Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fairfield University (Fairfield, CT) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy and straightforward. It consisted of one main interview. There were no technical questions. They asked me what my availability was because I was also a student.
Interview Questions: What were some of your previous work experiences.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fairfield University in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied and then was scheduled for a group interview and then an individual interview. During the Interview, I was lucky that I was involved in many activities and I was known in the office. I would recommend getting into clubs or sports to get your name known by the recruiters. The recruiters are the people who you will be working for and with.
Interview Questions: Asked me about my Jesuit Values and how I can contribute to a community.

title: Graduate Assistant Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fairfield University
Interview Descriptions: Easy, sent resume in, and then had a phone interview. Accepted offer a few days later over the phone. Takes recent graduates, do not need to have any coaching experience.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the table that will help the team be successful

title: Assistant Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fairfield University
Interview Descriptions: I had interview with head coach and admin within the athletics department.  I was asked about experiences within the sport. interview was more conversation like than an actual interview.  very accommodating staff
Interview Questions: why coaching?

title: Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fairfield University (Fairfield, CT) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with the team of individuals the Operations Coordinator would be working with in a series of three meetings. This first included those who would be directly overseeing the Coordinator, then the other staff in the office, and finally HR to explain benefits and other perks of working at the University. This was followed up a few days later with a phone call by the Dean. They were very organized and quick. The process was a positive one.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my background and relevant skills in regards to said position.

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Fairfield University in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions:
It was fine. I had a phone interview at first and an on site interview couple of weeks after.  i 
got interviewed by 3 people in my on site interview. No specific technical question were asked. Questions were mostly about my background
Interview Questions: New methods for using their existing devices

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fairfield University (Fairfield, CT) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Direct Interview with Professor who has Research Project with them.
Skills testing
Checking Academic behavior and grades GPA  >3
Basic software coding knowledge and Testing Hard work and contribution
Testing coordinating with Team work 
Background checking
Interview Questions: Past Experience, Skills

title: Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Fairfield University (Fairfield, CT) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Many interviews, many people, many departments. Focus on religion. It is a beautiful place. Some good people. Some people are very "academic". I am not from the uni background so imagine that it might be a hard place to transition to
Interview Questions: Are you an alumni

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fairfield University in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process was much quicker than other institutions/organizations.  Dealt directly with the department seeking to fill the position.  It was refreshing to have an application for employment move along at a respective pace.
Interview Questions: Regarding confidentiality.

title: Facilities Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fairfield University (Fairfield, CT) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: easy, I just talked to the head of the facilities department and was offered the job a week later. I had a good experience, yet they were hard to contact
Interview Questions: easy

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fairfield University (Fairfield, CT) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with the supervisor and then with human resources.  They asked several question and also conducted a background check.  They also looked into my academic qualifications too before making an offer.
Interview Questions: Why you would like to work at the university

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fairfield University (Fairfield, CT) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with hiring manager and VP for Finance.  There was very little in the way of actual questions.  It was mostly the interviewer describing the role.  I would interject and ask questions where I could.  No B.S. interview questions.  Met with hiring manager for about and hour and maybe 20 minutes with the VP of finance
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Tech Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fairfield University (Fairfield, CT) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online, then was called in for in-person interview. 
Interview was based on typical questions: tell me about yourself, how do you structure priorities.
There were 2 interviewers at the same.
Interview Questions: Interview was based on typical questions: tell me about yourself, how do you structure priorities...

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fairfield University (Fairfield, CT) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Conversational; An overall check for competency and trustworthiness--nothing too difficult. Short hiring process and good communication about where you fall (how long you'll wait to hear, etc.) The new system is very forward about the salary expectation, but, that was not always the case. I think more transparency about what to expect for compensation is a positive change. Used to be tough to gauge if you were asked what you expected.
Interview Questions: Can you think of a time when it was necessary to be a good judge of character?

title: Student Affairs Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fairfield University (Fairfield, CT) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I met with people from several different departments, some outside of the Student Affairs Division.  They asked me about my background and why I wanted to work at Fairfield.  Everyone was welcoming and friendly, and I had a positive impression throughout the experience.  This was consistent with my experience throughout the time I worked at the University.
Interview Questions: I had to explain why my unconventional background would work well for the role I was interviewing for.  I was prepared for this line of questioning, but it was still tricky.

title: Media Relations Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Fairfield University (Fairfield, CT) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Emailed about the position, set up interview via email, very quick and basic questions
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult position you've held?
